title: How to Make Slime with Cornstarch and Body Wash

steps.headline: Gather the things you'll need.
steps.description: You'll need body wash, cornstarch, a spoon, a large bowl, and a container (such as a sealable plastic tub). Optionally, you can also get water and food coloring.

steps.headline: Pour the body wash into the bowl.
steps.description: In your bowl, put in as much body wash as you want, depending on how much slime you want to make.

steps.headline: Add two big spoonfuls of cornstarch.
steps.description: You may have to add more, depending on how much body wash you put in. Then, mix together.

steps.headline: Add food coloring.
steps.description: Optionally, if you want your slime to have a different color, you can add in food coloring and mix it again. Be careful not to add in more food coloring than you need, or the color will stain your hands.

steps.headline: Check the texture of the mixture.
steps.description: The slime should be doughy. If it's not, add more cornstarch. You can start kneading it with your hands, if desired. If you want stretchy slime, add a little bit of water and knead in well.

steps.headline: Knead until the slime is around the texture of play-dough.
steps.description: At this point, you've finished making the slime.

steps.headline: Store your slime.
steps.description: If you want to keep your slime squishy and stretchy, then keep it in an airtight container.
